result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy O. White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution of $11,323.84 on a payment scheduled as determined by his agent.

Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge.  
Pay costs.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.   
Defendant to write letter of apology to Worzalla Publishing and give to agent first.  
No contact with Worzalla Publishing except for the apology letter.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy O. White

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: requesting amendment to the Judgment of Conviction re: restitution surcharge

ADDRESS INFO for Timothy O. White
Current: 5110 Main Street, 54481,   (Effective: 09-23-2014)
Prior: No Permanent Address, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Timothy O. White in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Timothy O. White in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  W/H Sentence: 5 yrs Probabtion: Conditions:    Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.   Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.   Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge.  Defendant to write letter of apology to Worzalla Publishing and give to agent first.  No contact with Worzalla Publishing except for the apology letter. Pay restitution of $11,323.84.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Attorney apologizes to the Court.
BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
ADA makes sentencing statements.
Atty Mcfarland concurs with agreements and states 95 days credit.

BTC: W/H Sentence: 5 yrs Probabtion:  96 days credit stated by the Court.
Conditions:   
96 days jail - time served. 
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.   
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.   
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge.  
Defendant to write letter of apology to Worzalla Publishing and give to agent first.  
No contact with Worzalla Publishing except for the apology letter. 
Pay restitution of $11,323.84 on a payment scheduled as determined by his agent.
Pay costs.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 22, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 4, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Court calls case at 3:20 p.m. Defendant Timothy O. White in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Timothy O. White in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 14, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Timothy O. White appeared by video.  Attorney Erik McFarland in court. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Atty McFarland indicates there is a bond modification motion. 
Court informs Atty McFarland to file motion with Branch 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
